the ***wheat stitch™ scarf*** is the perfect blend of cozy texture and timeless style. designed with my **[signature wheat stitch][1]**, this scarf is worked flat in rows, starting with a simple foundation row and built up stitch by stitch until you reach your desired width. it’s a relaxing project that’s beginner-friendly yet still engaging for more experienced crocheters.

**this pattern includes 8 unique printable tags as a bonus.**

the pattern includes a **detailed sizing chart** with measurements for  children through adults, making it easy to create the perfect fit for anyone on your gift list. a detailed guide for using the yarn of your choice is also included. choose from two ribbing options: work a short ribbing for a clean, subtle edge, or extend it for a longer ribbed finish that makes the scarf extra eye-catching. finish your scarf by adding a playful fringe (optional), and pair it with a matching hat, mittens, and your favorite winter coat!

whether you’re making a cozy everyday accessory, a thoughtful handmade gift, or just want to try out the beautiful wheat stitch, this pattern will quickly become a go-to favorite in your collection. it’s versatile, stylish, and oh-so-squishy!

**why you’ll love this pattern:**

**advanced-beginner friendly:** work row by row, starting with a simple foundation and building the textured wheat stitch.

**multiple sizes (child to adult):** comes with a detailed chart to help you crochet the perfect length and width.

**two ribbing options:** choose short ribbing or longer ribbed edges for a clean or dramatic finish.

**optional fringe:** add a playful fringe to match your style (or skip it for a sleek look).

**bonus printable tags:** includes 8 unique tags—perfect for gifting your finished scarf.

**video tutorial included:** step-by-step visuals to guide you through the stitches.

**any yarn guide:** walk through the steps of how to substitute any yarn weight.

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this pattern.
